ShefRobot

Class Speaker

  • java.lang.Object
    • ShefRobot.Speaker

  • public class Speaker
extends Object
    Objects of this class represent the audio interface to the Robot which it was created from
    See Also:
    Robot.getSpeaker()

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int VOLUME_MAX
      The maximum integer that can be passed to setVolume or returned from getVolume
      static int VOLUME_MIN
      The minimum integer that can be passed to setVolume or returned from getVolume

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getVolume()
      Returns the current volume of the robots speaker
      void playTone(int freq, int duration)
      Synchronously plays a tone of the specified frequency and duration through the robots speaker (The current thread will be stalled whilst tone is playing)
      void setVolume(int volume)
      Sets the volume of the robots speaker

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • VOLUME_MAX

        public static final int VOLUME_MAX
        The maximum integer that can be passed to setVolume or returned from getVolume
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • VOLUME_MIN

        public static final int VOLUME_MIN
        The minimum integer that can be passed to setVolume or returned from getVolume
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getVolume

        public int getVolume()
        Returns the current volume of the robots speaker
        Returns:
        The current volume of the robots speaker, the value will be in the range of VOLUME_MIN-VOLUME_MAX.

      • setVolume

        public void setVolume(int volume)
        Sets the volume of the robots speaker
        Parameters:
        volume - The volume the robot should play sounds at, value must be in the range VOLUME_MIN-VOLUME_MAX.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When volume argument is outside of the range VOLUME_MIN-VOLUME_MAX.

      • playTone

        public void playTone(int freq,
                     int duration)
        Synchronously plays a tone of the specified frequency and duration through the robots speaker (The current thread will be stalled whilst tone is playing)
        Parameters:
        freq - The frequency of the tone in Hertz (Hz).
        duration - The duration of the tone, in milliseconds (ms).
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - When freq or duration arguments are below 1.
